description:
Alice is interested in sequences. He also has preferences for integers. She thinks n integers a1, a2 … an. Now she is interested in good sequences. A sequence X1, X2, ..., X is called good if it satisfies the following three conditions:

The sequence is strictly increasing, 
No two adjacent elements are coprime, i.e.gcd(x[i],x[i+1])>1 for each i (1 ≤ i ≤ k - 1) (where gcd(p, q) denotes the greatest common divisor of the integers p and q).

Find the length of the longest good sequence.

#### `Input:`

- `The input consists of two lines.` 
- `The first line contains a single integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 105) — the number of good integers.` 
- `The second line contains a single-space separated list of good integers a1, a2, ..., an in strictly increasing order (1 ≤a[i]≤ 10^5)`

#### `Output:`

- `Print a single integer — the length of the longest good sequence.`

#### `Sample :1`

#### `Input:` 
```
5
2 3 4 6 9
```
#### `Output :`
`4`
#### `Sample:2`

#### `Input :` 
```
9

1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
```
#### Output : 
`4`
title: Longest Sequence
